meanings.definition: To advise or train someone, especially a younger colleague.
meanings.sent1: She mentored her new coworker on how to use the computer system.
meanings.sent2: The experienced teacher mentored the young student teacher throughout the semester.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl mentored the curious squirrel on the ways of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The seasoned chef mentored the aspiring cook, shaping her skills like clay.
meanings.sent5: He mentored his little brother in the art of building model airplanes, patiently guiding him step by step.

meanings.definition: To act as a mentor to someone.
meanings.sent1: The retired professor mentored many students over the years, helping them navigate their academic journeys.
meanings.sent2: She mentored a group of young entrepreneurs, sharing her experiences and insights.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dolphin mentored the lost fish, showing it the way back to its school.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse mentored the ships, guiding them safely through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: He mentored the young artist, nurturing her talent and encouraging her creativity.
